project.description: The Deploy job is used to deploy a working application onto a target environment. This job is typically run after the Target Environment job. In order to use this job for deploying an application, enter in the same value you used for the "STACK_NAME" when running the Target Environment job into the "STACK_NAME" parameter in this job. Jenkins will do the rest!

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# Get Language Language=`ruby ${WORKSPACE}/lib/showback_domain.rb --sdbdomain ${SIMPLEDB_STACK} \ --item properties \ --key Language`
if [ $deployToProduction == true ] then cd ${WORKSPACE}/deployment/ cap production ${Language} database:migration stack=${STACK_NAME} key=/usr/share/tomcat6/.ssh/id_rsa language=${Language} sdbdomain=${SIMPLEDB_STACK} else cd ${WORKSPACE}/deployment/ cap staging ${Language} deploy database:migration stack=${STACK_NAME} key=/usr/share/tomcat6/.ssh/id_rsa language=${Language} sdbdomain=${SIMPLEDB_STACK} fi
# Get Application Stack Instance Autoscaling Group AutoScalingGroup=`ruby ${WORKSPACE}/lib/showback_domain.rb --sdbdomain ${SIMPLEDB_STACK} \ --item ${STACK_NAME} \ --key AutoscalingGroup`
# Get first Instance in Autoscaling Group's IP address HOST=`ruby ${WORKSPACE}/lib/return_instance_in_as_group.rb --autoscalingGroup ${AutoScalingGroup}`
cucumber ${WORKSPACE}/deployment/features/deployment.feature host=${HOST} user=ec2-user key=/usr/share/tomcat6/.ssh/id_rsa
# Email User about deployment ruby ${WORKSPACE}/lib/send_deploy_email.rb --email ${EMAIL} \ --ipaddress ${HOST} \ --sender havoc@stelligent.com
if [ $deployToProduction == true ] then # Get Load Balancer DNS name LoadBalancerDNS=`ruby ${WORKSPACE}/lib/showback_domain.rb --sdbdomain ${SIMPLEDB_STACK} \ --item ${STACK_NAME} \ --key LoadBalancerDNS`
# Perform DNS switchover route53 --zone stelligent.com. -g --name havoc.stelligent.com. --type CNAME --ttl 600 --values ${LoadBalancerDNS} fi
